title: 114_hr1995
content: The Act may be cited as the "Local Zoning and Property Rights Protection Act of 2015". It involves the withdrawal of rules and notices. The "Local Zoning and Property Rights Protection Act of 2015" requires the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to withdraw proposed and final rules related to fair housing within 30 days of enactment. This includes the withdrawal of the Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing Assessment Tool notice. The "Local Zoning and Property Rights Protection Act of 2015" mandates the withdrawal of proposed and final rules related to fair housing within 30 days of enactment, including the Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing Assessment Tool notice. Additionally, any notice or rule substantially similar to the withdrawn rules must also be withdrawn. SEC. 3. FEDERALISM CONSULTATION AND REPORT. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must consult with State and local officials, as well as public housing agencies, to develop recommendations in line with the Fair Housing Act. Consultation requirements include providing notice and opportunities for participation, and seeking input from a diverse range of perspectives in the United States. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must collaborate with State and local officials, as well as public housing agencies, to develop recommendations aligned with the Fair Housing Act. The consultation process should emphasize transparency, timely input, and exploring alternative means to achieve Federal objectives. Within 12 months of the Act's enactment, a draft report with recommendations must be published in the Federal Register. The draft report in the Federal Register must include recommendations developed with consensus among the Secretary, State and local officials, and public housing agencies. If consensus is not reached on a regulatory proposal, the report should indicate the areas of agreement and disagreement. The Secretary must make the draft report available for public review and comment for at least 180 days. A final report describing the results of the consultation process must be prepared within 12 months of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary must make the final report available online within 12 months of the Act's enactment. Definitions for "Secretary," "local government official," "State official," and "public housing agency" are provided in this Act. The term "agency" is defined in the United States Housing Act of 1937.
